content: People look-up - The University of Nottingham UK China Malaysia Main Menu Study About Research Business News Visit Aâ€“Z Search You are here: University of NottinghamComputer SciencePeople School of Computer Science HomeAbout the SchoolStudy with usResearchInternshipsWork with usEquality Diversity and Inclusion People Honorary appointments EventsNewsContact us Print Email this Page Student Intranet Tony PridmoreHead of School of Computer Science, Faculty of Science Download to vCardBack to the Staff Directory Personal DetailsResearchPublications Contact workRoom C32 Computer ScienceJubilee CampusWollaton RoadNottinghamNG8 1BBUKwork0115 84 66510fax0115 95 14254tony.pridmore@nottingham.ac.ukhttp://www.cs.nott.ac.uk/~tpp BiographyTony Pridmore is Professor and Head of the School of Computer Science at the University of Nottingham. He holds a BSc in Computer Science from the University of Warwick and a PhD in Computer Vision from the Department of Psychology, University of Sheffield. Before returning to Computer Science in 1999 he held academic posts in both Information and Manufacturing Engineering.Expertise SummaryBuilding on his theoretical and applied work in computer vision, Tony's current focus is the development of large-scale infrastructures supporting research in plant phenomics - the automatic, objective measurement of the structural and functional properties of large numbers of (usually food-producing) plants. He is Director of PhenomUK, the UK national plant phenotyping network, UK Scientific Representative on the General Assembly of the ESFRI supported, pan-European infrastructure EMPHASIS and a member of the Scientific and Industrial Advisory Board of ELIXIR. Tony is co-founder and a member of the management board of the Hounsfield Facility, a unique installation providing automated extraction of 3D structural descriptions of plants from X-ray data.Research SummaryMy research interests centre on the establishment and maintenance of large scale, distributed research infrastructures making plant phenotyping facilities available nationally and internationally.Selected Publications MICHAEL POUND, ALEXANDRA J BURGESS, MICHAEL H WILSON, JONATHAN A ATKINSON, MARCUS GRIFFITHS, AARON S JACKSON, ADRIAN BULAT, GEORGIOS TZIMIROPOULOS, DARREN M WELLS, ERIK H MURCHIE, TONY P PRIDMORE and ANDREW P FRENCH, 2016. View all publications Past ResearchPrevious work has addressed issues in binocular stereo, knowledge-based image interpretation (particularly the interpretation of images of mechanical and other drawings), visual tracking and bioimage analysis. All my work has mixed the development of novel methods with their application to real-world problems.
